title: The "Payment Methods" section has disappeared.
content:
Good morning, the "Payment Methods" section has disappeared. In its place, I see a link called "Manage passkey in system settings," which takes me to the Windows 11 Passkey section, which I've NEVER enabled!

If I create a new profile, the "Payment Methods" section appears as normal, but when I link it to my Microsoft account for profile sync, the "Payment Methods" section disappears and "Manage passkey in system settings" reappears.

How can I fix this? Thanks
creator: lukyhome

title: Sezione "Metodi di pagamento" scomparsa.
content:
Buongiorno, è scompara la sezione "Metodi di pagamento". Al suo posto trovo un link denominato "Gestisci passkey nelle impostazioni di sistema" che mi rimanda alla sezione Passkey di Windows 11 che non ho MAI abilitato!

Se creo un nuovo profilo la sezione "Metodi di pagamento" appare regolarmente, ma quando lo associo al mio account Microsoft per la sincronizzazione del profilo, ecco che la sezione "Metodi di pagamento" sparisce e riappare "Gestisci passkey nelle impostazioni di sistema".

Come posso risolvere? Grazie
creator: lukyhome

title: Container tab opening on its own
content:
Hi,

I'm using Containers to switch between four different workloads, three companies and personal things.

However, if I have a tab opened with a host that is common to two or more containers, i.e. Google Drive, Firefox will continuously duplicate the tab and ask if I'd like to "Open this site in your assigned Container?"

The tab in the attached image is already opened with the document, but despite that Firefox will duplicate the tab, asking the above question. If I pass some time without visiting the group where the tab is, I have to sometimes close tenths of such tabs.

Any help is appreciated, Containers are amazing but it's really bothersome to have to keep closing tabs all the time.

Andre
creator: andre33

title: {Please learn to speak to your customers in a language we understand!
content:
Pages of text but I don't understand what the [expletive] you are doing or why! It's incoherent! Don't tell me what to do without telling me HOW to do it! We customers are not all software engineers. Unfortunately the software engineers who write everything I've been reading haven't learned that. I constantly read stuff that use terminology that is not self-explanatory. Then I'm asked to make a decision that is so badly defined that I have no idea what I'm deciding! SPEAK PLAIN ENGLISH!!!!! Don't ask me to choose among a list of options that YOU have defined, but none of which have any relationship to what I need to know. The "which topic" box just above this one is a perfect example. It took me a long time to even find this opportunity to speak to you! Choosing between incoherent options does not advance clarity for me or knowledge for you. Just stop using computer lingo and speak in a manner that would be understood by a 9 year old, or in my case, a 79 year old retired mechanical engineer. Thank you for giving me this opportunity to actually vent my frustration at what I run into on a daily basis, not just with Mozilla. Tom Riddering, [email address]

P.S. This whole incoherent mess this evening started when I tried to authorize McAfee to protect me from trackers, just exactly what that means I'm not sure, but it sounds bad. It's not at all clear just what would be tracked, who would bother tracking me, and why I need protecting. My life is so utterly boring.
